Name: tempering, flat glass | tempering, flat glass | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/231:Manufacture of glass and glass products/2310:Manufacture of glass and glass products
Description: The glass sheet is heated to a temperature just below its softening point (about 640Â°C) and then immediately cooled by special jets of cold-air. These harden the surface of the glass, giving the inside more time to cool. This allows the external layer to crystallize into a wider lattice while the inside solidifies with greater compression than in the crystal lattice.
